subsection_name: coi-xuong.json_3_Subjects at risk are susceptible to rickets
subsection_content:
Rickets can occur at any age but is more common in children, especially children from 6 months to 3 years old. At this time, the child's skeletal system is developing and not yet stable, so the child will be at higher risk of disease. Furthermore, children will have a higher risk of getting sick if they live in places that lack sunlight and have poor nutrition.
>>>See now: What nutrients do children with rickets lack?
